result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J. Henthorne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
to begin on or before 07/24/22; with huber.

Absolute sobriety until the sentence is completed.

records.addlTxt: (submitted to Accts Payable 8/11/21; reimbursement plan set up with Def per conditions of the order)

9:42 AM 21CM107/22CM07 - Defendant Alex J. Henthorne in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Alex J. Henthorne.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt informs the court that there is an agreement  to amend 21CM107 to 79.4 with $50 plus costs along with entering a plea in 22CM7 for 30 days jail. Defendant enters a guilty plea. Court speaks about the plea questionnaire. Court finds the defendant guilty of 22CM7. Court amends 21CM107 with $50 plus costs. Attorney Harper speaks about the joint recommendation of 22CM7. Court speaks to parties. Defense states that there is 1 day of credit. Attorney Bartelt speaks about the defendant background and asks that the defendant have 2 week to report to jail. Defendant would like 30 days to report instead of a couple weeks. Attorney Harper ask for absolute sobriety until he reports to jail. Court asks about the bond continuing. Attorney Harper speaks about if it was just an order of the court.

Court orders 
30 day in the county jail to begin on or before 07/24/22; with huber.
1 day credit.
Absolute sobriety until the sentence is completed.

9:29 AM 21CM107/22CM07 - Defendant Alex J. Henthorne in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Alex J. Henthorne.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt asks for a plea and sentencing in 30 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:28 PM 21CM107/22CM07 - Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by video means for Defendant Alex J. Henthorne. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alex J. Henthorne appeared by phone means. Attorney Bartelt has met with his client, waives the formal reading and stands mute to all counts. Max penalties stated.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:11 PM 22CM07/21CM107 - Defendant Alex J. Henthorne appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. AH request a court appoint attorney. 

Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Peter Bartelt. Defendant to deposit $50/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 02/11/22 . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

No "Notice to those Posting Cash Bond" was filled out at Dispatch"
Document indicates the depositor is "A. Houston"

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.
